channel.title: A little advice
channel.description: So Im attemping to buy a webhost,domain and a vps tomarrow Im buying the host from hostgator,what do you guys suggest for a cheap vps and domain?

item.title: A little advice
item.dc:creator: @stCky stCky
item.description:
@stCky wrote:

Our domains were random letters too, along the lines of awlele.com usuaise.com oeaoe.com etc perhaps it was because they were $1? I don’t know but I have no other way to explain it - I also had only just signed up to godaddy with this e-mail address and as it’s more of a business e-mail than a personal one I haven’t signed up to many, if any services…Your mileage may vary

Read full topic

item.title: A little advice
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

thats odd. perhaps the domain itself was flagged before it was parked. only thing that makes sense to me as i dont see anyone coming up with my domain as its random letters lol

Read full topic

item.title: A little advice
item.dc:creator: @stCky stCky
item.description:
@stCky wrote:

I bought a domain a month ago from GoDaddy, within 24 hours of purchasing, before I even set up DNS or hosting, I had 5+ spam seo/blog service emails from random company names regarding the domain I had just bought, co-worker has a similar story as well as the person I was buying domains with at the time. Aside from that and terrible customer service, they’re cheap - you get what you pay for.

Read full topic

item.title: A little advice
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

idk what youre referring to? ive had my domain for months and my whois information is public and ive yet to receive any type of spam email?

also, i heard hostgator isnt great so ive never used it. dont wanna test a product if i think its bad lol. but if its good for you, save the extra $8

Read full topic

item.title: A little advice
item.dc:creator: @stCky stCky
item.description:
@stCky wrote:

emperor1975:

I decided to use godaddy for the domain,Its bretty cheap

Bugger, enjoy your info being shared and random spam e-mails from day 1

emperor1975:

And I might use digitalocean,its bretty cheap

Nice.

emperor1975:

And hostgator only costs 3.95$ for hosting

Ehhh, bit common and they’re probably as spammy as godaddy

Read full topic

as for vps probs digital ocean
